thread.title: Austrian court grants U.S. request to extradite Ukrainian mogul Firtash
thread.title_full: Austrian court grants U.S. request to extradite Ukrainian mogul Firtash

title: Austrian court grants U.S. request to extradite Ukrainian mogul Firtash
text:
30pm GMT Austrian court grants U.S. request to extradite Ukrainian mogul Firtash left Ukrainian oligarch Dmytro Firtash arrives at court in Vienna, Austria, February 21, 2017. REUTERS/Heinz-Peter Bader 1/4 Ukrainian oligarch Dmytro Firtash arrives at court in Vienna, Austria, February 21, 2017. REUTERS/Heinz-Peter Bader 2/4 left right Ukrainian oligarch Dmytro Firtash, his wife Lada and lawyer Dieter Boehmdorfer arrive at court in Vienna, Austria, February 21, 2017. REUTERS/Heinz-Peter Bader 3/4 Ukrainian oligarch Dmytro Firtash arrives at court in Vienna, Austria, February 21, 2017. REUTERS/Heinz-Peter Bader 4/4 
VIENNA An Austrian court on Tuesday granted a request by the United States to extradite Ukrainian mogul Dmytro Firtash over bribery allegations. 
The court in Vienna overturned a previous Austrian court decision to reject the extradition request on the grounds that it was politically motivated. 
"The (appeal against the previous decision) has been granted," the judge told the court packed with journalists and Firtash's family. "This does not mean that somebody is being pre-judged as guilty, but rather that it will be decided in another country whether they are guilty or innocent." 
Firtash, a former supporter of ousted Moscow-friendly president Viktor Yanukovich who made a fortune selling Russian gas to the Ukrainian government, denies the U.S. allegations. 
(Reporting by Shadia Nasralla; Editing by Catherine Evans) Next In World News
